meanings.definition: Using an apostrophe to indicate possession or omission in writing.
meanings.sent1: Her apostrophising of the dog's tail made the story more engaging.
meanings.sent2: I noticed her apostrophising of the book's title for emphasis.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's apostrophising of the whiteboard was so precise, it looked like art.
meanings.sent4: His apostrophising of the tree's branches with fairy lights created a magical effect.
meanings.sent5: The author's apostrophising of the character's thoughts brought them to life on the page.

meanings.definition: The act of adding an apostrophe to a word to show possession or contraction.
meanings.sent1: The apostrophising of the cat's name on the collar was done with care.
meanings.sent2: I could see the apostrophising of the sign to indicate a contraction.
meanings.sent3: His apostrophising of the menu's items made them seem more exclusive.
meanings.sent4: The apostrophising of the clock's hands symbolized the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: Her apostrophising of the company's logo gave it a personal touch.
